title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement chris2018hou@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct

title: Contributing to BatchSVG
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to BatchSVG
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to BatchSVG
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("christinehou11/BatchSVG", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to BatchSVG
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: BatchSVG package developed unrelated DLPFC dataset available spatialLIBD package. first chose binomial deviance model scry feature selection method can incorporate batch variable model. Next, compared per-gene ranks dispersion values model run without batch effect. data-driven thresholding approach using cutoffs based number standard deviance (nSD) deviance rank difference metrics. Based self-selected nSD cutoffs, genes identified biased can filtered . methodology details can found Find Bias Feature written Jacqui Thompson, documentation related codes can found GitHub.

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: BatchSVG R package. Install development version GitHub.

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: Install BatchSVG Load required packages
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("BatchSVG")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid() library(BatchSVG) library(ExperimentHub) library(SpatialExperiment) library(SummarizedExperiment) library(tidyr) library(dplyr) library(tibble)

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: object also saved ExperimentHub package named humanHippocampus2024, development version GitHub available. dataset tutorial section spatialHPC. filtered 4 samples. ran nnSVG identify spatially-variable genes (SVGs). filtered top 2000 significant features 4 samples. ’re using filterer features top 2000 >1 sample. Finally, obtained 2082 SVGs.
code: ehub <- ExperimentHub() spe <- ehub[["EH9605"]] spe # 31483, 150917 fix_order <- distinct(     as.data.frame(colData(spe)), slide, array, brnum, sample_id,      position, sex) %>%      arrange(slide, array) sub4 <- fix_order$sample_id[c(14,16, 20,21)]  spe_sub4 <- spe[,spe$sample_id %in% sub4] spe_sub4 # 31483, 18945 res_ranks <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata","res_ranks.csv",package = "BatchSVG"),     row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE)  res_df_sub4 <- pivot_longer(     rownames_to_column(as.data.frame(res_ranks), var<-"gene_id"),      colnames(res_ranks), names_to="sample_id", values_to="rank",      values_drop_na=TRUE)  res_df2_sub4 <- filter(res_df_sub4, sample_id %in%     c("V11L05-333_B1","V11L05-333_D1","V11L05-335_D1","V11L05-336_A1"),         rank <= 2000) # top 2k sig features nrow(res_df2_sub4) # 7559  svgs_sub4 <- group_by(res_df2_sub4, gene_id) %>%      tally() %>%      filter(n>1) # >1 sample  nrow(svgs_sub4) # 2082  head(svgs_sub4)

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: data frame created featureSelect() function includes nSD_dev nSD_rank, can use biasDetect() function identify bias genes based self-selected nSD integer thresholds deviance rank respectively. default threshold 5 deviance 5 rank. ’s , biasDetect function allows return biased genes either data frame format plots. default format data frame. see plots, add visual = TRUE. Figure ) SVGs relative change deviance >= 10 SDs mean Figure b) SVGs rank difference >= 5 SDs mean Finally, can obtain newer spe_sub4 object without biased genes.
code: SVGs <- svgs_sub4$gene_id batch_df <- featureSelect(spe_sub4, batch_effect = "sample_id", VGs = SVGs) dim(batch_df) head(batch_df) bias <- biasDetect(batch_df = batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5) bias bias_fig <- biasDetect(batch_df = batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5, visual = TRUE) bias_fig$deviance bias_fig$rank svgs_filt = setdiff(rownames(svgs_sub4), bias) length(svgs_filt)

title: Find Bias Features - Spatial Transcriptomics Data
text: Please read reference documentation detailed codes scripts conducting PRECAST clustering removing biased gene.

code: @Manual{,   title = {BatchSVG: Identify Batch-Biased Features in Spatially Variable Genes},   author = {Christine Hou and Jacqui Thompson and Stephanie C. Hicks},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.99.1, https://github.com/christinehou11/BatchSVG},   url = {https://christinehou11.github.io/BatchSVG/}, }

title: Identify Batch-Biased Features in Spatially Variable Genes
text: BatchSVG feature-based Quality Control (QC) bias genes identification spatial transcriptomics snRNA-seq data types batch effect. BatchSVG method based binomial deviance model (Townes et al, 2019) applies cutoffs based standard deviation (SD) deviance rank difference metrics data-driven thresholding approach find batch-biased features.

title: Identify Batch-Biased Features in Spatially Variable Genes
text: BatchSVG R package available Bioconductor version 3.19 later. can install BatchSVG using following commands R session Bioconductor. development version can obtained
code: if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE)) {     install.packages("BiocManager") }  BiocManager::install("BatchSVG")  ## Check that you have a valid Bioconductor installation BiocManager::valid() BiocManager::install("christinehou11/BatchSVG")

title: Identify Batch-Biased Features in Spatially Variable Genes
text: detailed tutorial available Find Biased Features written Jacqui Thompson.

title: Identify Batch-Biased Features in Spatially Variable Genes
text: Please note BatchSVG project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Biased Genes Identification — biasDetect
text: Function identify bias genes based user-selected threshold number standard deviation relative change deviance rank difference.

title: Biased Genes Identification — biasDetect
text: list_batch_df list : list data frame(s) generated featureSelection() function. length data frame list least one. nSD_dev integer: numeric vector specifying number standard deviation (nSD) batch analyzing relative change deviance. order values must correspond order batches list_batch_df. single value provided, applied batches; otherwise, must length list_batch_df. nSD_rank vector: numeric vector specifying number standard deviation (nSD) batch analyzing rank differences. order values must correspond order batches list_batch_df. single value provided, applied batches; otherwise, must length list_batch_df. visual logical: Whether display detected bias genes visualizations deviance rank. Default FALSE. visual = TRUE, returned format two parallel plots presenting bias genes based nSD_dev nSD_rank.

title: Biased Genes Identification — biasDetect
text: output values list lists identified bias genes.

title: Biased Genes Identification — biasDetect
code: batch_df <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata","hpc_srt_batch_df.csv",package = "BatchSVG"),     row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE) # data frame bias <- biasDetect(batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5) #> Error in biasDetect(batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5): is.data.frame(batch_df) is not TRUE bias #> Error: object 'bias' not found # plots bias_plot <- biasDetect(batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5, visual = TRUE) #> Error in biasDetect(batch_df, nSD_dev = 10, nSD_rank = 5, visual = TRUE): unused argument (visual = TRUE) # deviance bias_plot$deviance #> Error: object 'bias_plot' not found # rank bias_plot$rank #> Error: object 'bias_plot' not found

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
text: Function conduct feature selection spatial transcriptomics data calculate difference deviance rank without selected batch effect.

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
text: input SpatialExperiment: SpatialExperiment input data. assumed assays slot containing counts assay devianceFeatureSelection() successfully operate calculate deviance rank. logcounts strongly recommended included assays. Also, input data assumed set rownames(input) genes gene_name rowData(input). input can either raw complete data object filtered data object containing spatially varaible genes (SVGs). batch_effects list: batch effect (slide subject) based metadata available within input data. name batch effect within input object specified based different scenarios. VGs character: Spatially Variable Genes (SVGs) SpatialExperiment object. data frame, assumed contain one column identified variable genes column name gene name/ID, e.g. "ENSG00000002330".

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect
text: output values returned list data frames containing deviance rank without bacth effect, corresponding difference, corresponding nSD, gene, gene name, whether gene outlier defined chosen deviance rank cutoff. length list data frames equal number batch effects included.

title: Feature Selection — featureSelect

To cite Bioconductor, see #>     'citation("Biobase")', and for packages 'citation("pkgname")'. #>  #> Attaching package: ‘Biobase’ #> The following object is masked from ‘package:MatrixGenerics’: #>  #>     rowMedians #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:matrixStats’: #>  #>     anyMissing, rowMedians # "V11L05-333_B1","V11L05-333_D1","V11L05-335_D1","V11L05-336_A1" load(system.file("extdata","spe_sub4.rda",package = "BatchSVG")) #> Warning: cannot open compressed file '', probable reason 'No such file or directory' #> Error in readChar(con, 5L, useBytes = TRUE): cannot open the connection # load SVGs from 4 samples svgs_sub4 <- read.csv(     system.file("extdata","svgs_sub4.csv", package = "BatchSVG"),     row.names = 1, check.names = FALSE) # rank <= 2000, sample n > 1 #> Warning: file("") only supports open = "w+" and open = "w+b": using the former #> Error in read.table(file = file, header = header, sep = sep, quote = quote,     dec = dec, fill = fill, comment.char = comment.char, ...): no lines available in input SVGs <- svgs_sub4$gene_id #> Error: object 'svgs_sub4' not found  batch_df <- featureSelect(spe_sub4,      batch_effects = c("sample_id", "sex"), VGs = SVGs) #> Error: object 'spe_sub4' not found

title: BatchSVG 0.99.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. First full version package submitted Bioconductor.
